page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Railway Line continued The line closed on 12 June 1961 and by that time the traffic had almost ceased and the freight had taken to the roads All Saints Church Horsmonden This Church was built just over 100 years ago as an Anglican Church and was sold to the Roman Catholic Church in the 1970s and masses are held on each Sunday and Holy Day the priest coming from Goudhurst All Saints was built by the Anglicans as an alternative to the parish church of St. Margarets which was on the site of the old village of Horsmonden The village was moved to what is known as The Heath and villagers wanted their church nearer but its congregation returned to St. Margarets when more of the population had cars
